p: All of the positive evaluative statements, which were rated on a 5-point Likert scale (1 = strongly disagree, 5 = strongly agree), received a mean score greater than 4 (response rate: 34 of 51 participants, 67%; Table 2). The highest mean scores were for the following statements: “I am glad I attended this event” (M = 4.4), “This event helped me feel connected to my motivations for pursuing medicine” (M = 4.3), and “I think the community organizing skillset (including public narrative, story of self) is an important one for a physician to possess” (M = 4.3).
